item.title: Galaxy S25 Ultra to launch with groundbreaking AI feature, Samsung says it draws anything you can imagine - The Financial Express
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra Set to Launch with Innovative AI Features

Date: January 22, 2025 Source: Financial Express

Samsung is set to launch the highly anticipated Galaxy S25 series on January 22, featuring groundbreaking updates to its AI capabilities.

  • Launch date is confirmed for January 22, 2025.
  • Major upgrades to the “Sketch to Image” feature are implemented.
  • The upgraded tool will allow users to generate images from sketches as well as text prompts.
  • The S25 Ultra is expected to have an S-Pen, which enhances the drawing capabilities.
  • Promotional leaks suggest a deep blue color scheme for the S25 series.
“If it can be envisioned, Galaxy AI can create it.”

With the arrival of the Galaxy S25 series, Samsung aims to redefine mobile AI, offering new functionalities that will likely have lasting implications on user experience.

item.title: January Patch Tuesday resolves 3 Hyper-V zero-days - TechTarget
item.description:
January Patch Tuesday resolves 3 Hyper-V zero-days

Date: January 14, 2025
Source: TechTarget

This January, Microsoft addressed one of the highest numbers of vulnerabilities in recent memory, including three critical zero-day exploits affecting Hyper-V.

  • 159 unique CVEs corrected, with 10 rated critical.
  • Majority of vulnerabilities affected Windows OS, with eight critical ones.
  • Three Hyper-V zero-days identified as CVE-2025-21333, CVE-2025-21334, and CVE-2025-21335, all with a 7.8 CVSS score.
  • These vulnerabilities allow attackers to gain system-level privileges without user interaction.
  • Other notable security updates include CVE-2025-21298 and CVE-2025-21311, both with a CVSS score of 9.8.
"Microsoft confirmed these as exploits in the wild... treat them as critical and give them a higher priority." - Chris Goettl

The patching of these vulnerabilities is crucial for organizations using Hyper-V, as they do not have alternative mitigations.

item.title: OpenAI rolls out assistant-like feature ‘Tasks’ to take on Alexa, Siri - The Hindu
item.description:
OpenAI Unveils 'Tasks' Feature for ChatGPT to Compete with Alexa and Siri

Published: January 15, 2025 09:44 am IST | Source: The Hindu

OpenAI has introduced a new beta feature called Tasks to ChatGPT, marking its entry into the virtual assistant market where it will compete with established services like Amazon's Alexa and Apple's Siri.

  • Tasks allows users to request future actions like reminders and updates.
  • ChatGPT may suggest tasks based on user interactions, which can be accepted or declined.
  • The feature aims to keep ChatGPT competitive following the rise of AI in personal assistance.
  • Amazon and Apple are also enhancing their AI capabilities in response to the growing trend.
“The revamped version of Alexa—which will take actions for users without prompting—is slated to be released in the 'coming months',” said Amazon CEO Andy Jassy.

The rollout of Tasks will begin with Plus, Team, and Pro users, starting with the web platform.

item.title: Garena Free Fire MAX Redeem Codes for January 15: How to avail free in-game rewards - India TV News
item.description:
Garena Free Fire MAX Redeem Codes for January 15: How to avail free in-game rewards

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: India TV News

Garena, a popular gaming company, has released daily redeem codes for the popular battle royale game, Free Fire MAX, allowing players to claim various in-game items for free.

Key Points:

  • Redeem codes include emotes, weapon skins, and more, enhancing the gameplay experience.
  • Current codes valid for January 15, including: FFPSTXV5FRDM for Pushpa Emote, FXK2NDY5QSMX for Yellow Poker MP40, and several others.
  • Players must act quickly as codes are time-sensitive and region-specific.

How to Redeem Free Fire MAX codes:

  1. Visit the Free Fire MAX rewards redemption website: reward.ff.garena.com.
  2. Log in using your Free Fire MAX account credentials.
  3. Click on the redeem banner and enter the code in the provided field.
If successful, your rewards will be credited to your account within 24 hours.

Important points to note about the game:

  • Free Fire MAX is currently available in India; Free Fire remains banned.
  • Codes are region-specific—expired or incorrect codes may show an error message.
  • Players should redeem as quickly as possible due to time-sensitivity.

Conclusion: Use valid codes from official sources to ensure rewards and avoid errors.

item.title: Android co-founder to Bill Gates: So, sorry Bill, you're more responsible for Microsoft losing the $400 b - The Times of India
item.description:
Android co-founder to Bill Gates: So, sorry Bill, you're more responsible for Microsoft losing the $400 billion than you realize

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Tech News Daily

A well-known tech figure suggests that Bill Gates' leadership decisions have played a significant role in Microsoft's immense financial losses over recent years.

  • The Android co-founder emphasizes that strategic missteps have led to a staggering decline in Microsoft's valuation.
  • He argues that better decision-making could have prevented such losses.
  • Gates' past approaches to innovation and competition are scrutinized in light of new industry standards.
“If fundamental choices had been made differently, Microsoft might not have faced this staggering $400 billion loss.”

This perspective sheds light on the evolving tech landscape and raises questions about leadership accountability in major corporations.

Date & Source: January 14, 2025, India TV News

Flipkart’s Republic Day Monumental Sale is live with offers on the iPhone 16 series, running until January 19.

  • The iPhone 16 (128GB) is now priced at Rs 67,999 after a Rs 12,000 discount.

  • The iPhone 16 Pro has a Rs 7,000 price drop, now costing Rs 1,12,900.

Additional savings are available through bank discounts, especially for HDFC credit card users.

"The discounted prices may change during this sale, so timely purchases are recommended."

Grab these deals as inventory and prices may fluctuate quickly during the sale.

item.title: WhatsApp rolls out selfie stickers, new camera effects, and more - Moneycontrol
item.description:
WhatsApp Introduces New Selfie Stickers and Camera Effects

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Moneycontrol

WhatsApp has kicked off 2025 by introducing a series of updates designed to enhance chat interactions. These updates include fun camera effects and the ability to create selfie stickers.

  • Introduction of camera effects with 30 options for backgrounds, filters, and effects.
  • Launch of the Selfie Stickers feature, allowing users to create stickers from their selfies.
  • Ability to share sticker packs more easily.
  • Faster reactions within chats.
  • Camera effects are currently available on Android with plans for iOS soon.
“We’re always working on making WhatsApp more fun and easier to use, so we’re excited to kick off the new year with new features and design updates to improve your experience,” said WhatsApp in a blog post.

These updates reflect WhatsApp's commitment to maintaining relevance and enhancing user experience in messaging.

item.title: OpenAI rolls out assistant-like feature 'Tasks' to take on Alexa, Siri - Deccan Herald
item.description:
OpenAI Rolls Out Assistant-Like Feature 'Tasks' to Take on Alexa, Siri

Published: 15 January 2025, IST

Generative artificial intelligence leader OpenAI is rolling out a new beta feature called Tasks to ChatGPT, introducing functionalities that compete with virtual assistants like Apple’s Siri and Amazon’s Alexa.

  • Tasks allows users to set future reminders, manage one-time requests, and schedule recurring tasks.
  • ChatGPT can suggest tasks based on user interactions, which users can choose to accept or decline.
  • This feature comes amid increased competition, prompting Amazon to refresh Alexa with generative AI capabilities.
  • Apple has also incorporated AI features into Siri, enhancing its functionality with the help of OpenAI's technology.
  • The beta version will be available to Plus, Team, and Pro users globally via the web platform within a few days.
“With Tasks, users can efficiently manage their schedule and stay updated on important events,” said an OpenAI spokesperson.

This rollout signifies an important step for OpenAI as it expands its offerings in the competitive landscape of virtual assistants, enhancing user engagement and AI capabilities.

item.title: MGNREGS allocations could be increased for FY26 | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Potential Increase in MGNREGS Budget Allocations for FY26

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Mint

The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS), a crucial employment lifeline for the rural poor in India, may see increased budget allocations for FY26, according to sources familiar with the matter.

  • MGNREGS allocations are expected to remain flat for FY25 due to an improvement in the rural economy this year.
  • Moderate increases are anticipated for FY26 in comparison to the previous fiscal year.
  • The scheme is vital for providing employment to millions of impoverished Indians.

This anticipated increase highlights the government's commitment to supporting rural employment amid changing economic conditions.

item.title: MGNREGS allocations could be increased for FY26 - Mint
item.description:
Potential Increase in MGNREGS Allocations for FY26

Publication Date: New Delhi | Source: Mint

The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS) may see a higher budget allocation in FY26, following a year of improved rural economic conditions despite no hikes in FY25.

  • MGNREGS is crucial for providing employment to the rural poor in India.
  • Allocations for FY25 are expected to remain unchanged due to recent improvements in the rural economy.
  • FY26 may witness a slight increase in budget allocation compared to FY25.

item.title: Microsoft’s Massive Patch Tuesday Release Is ‘Ominous’ Sign For 2025: Researcher - CRN
item.description:
Microsoft’s Massive Patch Tuesday Release Is ‘Ominous’ Sign For 2025: Researcher

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Trend Micro

This month, Microsoft addressed a record number of vulnerabilities in its monthly software update, raising concerns for the future of security patches in 2025.

  • 159 new CVEs were fixed, the largest number in any single month since 2017.
  • 11 critical vulnerabilities were addressed.
  • This is more than double the usual amount of CVEs fixed in January.
  • Three flaws were exploited, impacting Windows Hyper-V.
“If you are running Hyper-V, make sure these patches are at the top of your list for testing and deployment.” - Dustin Childs, Trend Micro

The significant rise in vulnerabilities addressed may indicate an ongoing issue in 2025, prompting users to remain vigilant with their patch updates.

item.title: DJI Flip is a $439, fully foldable camera drone - TechCrunch
item.description:
DJI Flip is a $439, fully foldable camera drone

Date: Not provided
Source: TechCrunch

DJI has introduced the Flip, a foldable drone priced at $439, aimed at photographers and videographers. It offers high-quality 4K video recording, 48-megapixel stills, and improved battery life.

  • The Flip weighs 249 grams and is designed for portability.
  • It features a 4K 60fps video capability and a 48MP camera with 4x zoom.
  • The drone boasts 31 minutes of battery life, surpassing the Neo's 18 minutes.
  • It includes automatic collision avoidance and improved charging features.
  • The Flip will start shipping in the U.S. soon.
“The Flip combines the simplicity of the DJI Neo with the stunning photo capabilities of the DJI Mini.”

In conclusion, the DJI Flip represents a step forward for consumer drones, merging compact design with powerful features, aimed primarily at outdoor photographers.

item.title: WhatsApp Adds More Video Effects, Improved Reactions UI - Social Media Today
item.description:
WhatsApp Adds More Video Effects, Improved Reactions UI

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

WhatsApp has rolled out new updates aimed at providing more creative options for users' private chats, enhancing engagement.

  • New camera effects for video calls to expand creative options.
  • Incorporation of 30 backgrounds, filters, and effects for videos and photos in chats.
  • Ability to create stickers from selfies through a new 'Create sticker' function.
  • Sharing sticker packs directly within chats is now possible.
  • Simplified UI for reacting to messages, with a double-tap feature for quick reactions.
“You loved the effects we launched on video calls last year. Now, when you take and send a video or photos in your chats, you can choose from the same 30 backgrounds, filters and effects to transform your shots.” - WhatsApp
“Just tap ‘Create sticker’ and you’ll see the camera option to take a selfie and create your sticker.”
“Now you can double tap a message to react and quickly scroll through your most-used reactions.”

These updates, although minor, are significant in enhancing WhatsApp's role as a critical connector in private messaging, especially as usage rises among users.

This leak builds anticipation ahead of the Galaxy S25 series launch and hints at the company’s new software updates.

item.title: Tata Electronics captures 26% share of India's iPhone production - Business Standard
item.description:
Tata Electronics Captures 26% Share of India's iPhone Production

Publication Date: January 14 2025 | Source: Business Standard

Tata Electronics has secured a significant share in the iPhone production market in India, achieving a 26% share and significantly increasing its workforce.

  • Tata Electronics experienced a 63% increase in direct employment, expanding its workforce from 19,000 to 31,000.
  • The company acquired Wistron's iPhone facility in Narsapura, Karnataka, for $125 million in October 2023.
  • Annual production at the plant soared to over Rs 40,000 crore in 2024, a 180% increase from Rs 14,300 crore in the previous year.
“During the year, Tata Electronics recorded a 63 per cent increase in direct employment at its iPhone assembly operations.”

This significant growth positions Tata Electronics firmly in the iPhone production sector in India, indicating strong progress and expansion for the company.
